== Conscience, belief, and code ==
 
== Conscience, belief, and code ==
 
{{weasel}}
 
{{weasel}}
−
[[Conscience]] refers to the impulse towards morally 'right' behavior. The actual definition of right behavior varies according to belief system. Religious belief systems usually include the idea of divine will and divine [[Last Judgment|judgment]] and usually correspond to a strict moral code of conduct. The forms of honor associated with Medieval Christian [[chivalry|knighthood]] and the forms of dress associated some sects of [[Islam]] are examples of this.
+
[[Conscience]] refers to the impulse towards morally 'right' behavior. The actual definition of right behavior varies according to belief system. Religious belief systems usually include the idea of divine will and divine [[Last Judgment|judgment]] and usually correspond to a strict moral code of conduct. The forms of honor associated with Medieval Christian [[chivalry|knighthood]] and the forms of dress associated with some sects of [[Islam]] are examples of this.
 
Forces of social [[conformity|conform]] also significantly shape moral decisions, although the effect of cultural [[norm (sociology)|norm]]s and [[convention (norm)|custom]]s on behavior does not address what morally right behavior is.
 
Forces of social [[conformity|conform]] also significantly shape moral decisions, although the effect of cultural [[norm (sociology)|norm]]s and [[convention (norm)|custom]]s on behavior does not address what morally right behavior is.
